subject: Chemistry

figures.description: Fig. 1 apparatus: heating solid ammonium chloride in a test tube with a porous asbestos plug and damp neutral litmus paper at the mouth. Used in Question 3.
Displayed structure for Question 17 showing a branched alkane/haloalkane-like chain: (CH3)2CH–CH2–CH3 (as drawn). Used for IUPAC/common naming.
Question 23 shows a general reaction mE + nF ⇌ pG + qH and multiple-choice forms of the equilibrium constant expression.

questions.question: The periodic classification of the elements is an arrangement of the elements in order of their
questions.explanation: The modern periodic table is arranged in order of increasing atomic number.

questions.question: If 1 litre of 2.2 M sulphuric acid is poured into a bucket containing 10 litres of water, and the resulting solution mixed thoroughly, the resulting sulphuric acid concentration will be
questions.explanation: Moles of acid added: \(n = CV = 2.2\times 1 = 2.2\,\text{mol}\). Final volume \(\approx 1 + 10 = 11\,\text{L}\). New concentration \(= \frac{2.2}{11} = 0.20\,\text{M}\). This value (0.20 M) is not among the options shown; the closest is 0.22 M (C), but using the given volumes, the accurate result is 0.20 M.

questions.question: In the above experiment (Fig. 1) the litmus paper will initially
questions.explanation: Heating \(\text{NH}_4\text{Cl}\) produces \(\text{NH}_3\) and \(\text{HCl}\). Damp neutral litmus responds to acidic \(\text{HCl}\) first at the mouth, turning red initially.

questions.question: A correct electrochemical series can be obtained from K, Na, Ca, Al, Mg, Zn, Fe, Pb, H, Cu, Hg, Ag, Au by interchanging
questions.explanation: In the standard reactivity/electrochemical series, Mg is more reactive than Al (Mg should come before Al). Interchanging Al and Mg corrects that ordering.

questions.question: A basic postulate of the kinetic theory of gases is that the molecules of a gas move in straight lines between collisions. This implies that

options.text: forces of repulsion and attraction are in equilibrium

questions.explanation: Kinetic theory assumes collisions between gas molecules are perfectly elastic.

questions.question:
On which of the following is the solubility of a gaseous substance dependent?
I. Nature of solvent
II. Nature of solute
III. Temperature
IV. Pressure
questions.explanation: Gas solubility depends on the nature of gas and solvent, temperature, and pressure (e.g., Henry’s law).

questions.question: Which of the following statements is correct about the periodic table?

options.text: Elements in the same period have the same number of valence electrons
The valence electrons of the elements in the same period increase progressively across the period.
Elements in the same group have the same number of electron shells
The non-metallic properties of the elements tend to decrease across each period.

questions.explanation: Across a period, electrons are added to the same outer shell so valence electrons generally increase from left to right.

questions.question: The boiling of fat and aqueous caustic soda is referred to as
questions.explanation: Boiling fats/oils with NaOH produces soap and glycerol; this is saponification (alkaline hydrolysis of esters).

questions.question: Which of the following pairs of substances will react further with oxygen to form a higher oxide?
questions.explanation: SO2 can be oxidized to SO3, and NO can be oxidized to NO2; both can form higher oxides.

questions.question: In the preparation of oxygen by heating KClO3 in the presence of MnO2, only moderate heat is needed because the catalyst acts by

options.text: lowering the pressure of the reaction
increasing the surface area of the reaction
increasing the rate of the reaction
lowering the energy barrier of the reaction

questions.explanation: A catalyst provides an alternative pathway with lower activation energy (energy barrier).

questions.question: Methanoic acid mixes with water in all proportions and has about the same boiling point as water. Which of the following methods would you adopt to obtain pure water from a mixture of sand, water and methanoic acid?

options.text: neutralization with sodium hydroxide followed by distillation
neutralization with sodium hydroxide followed by filtration

questions.explanation: First neutralize methanoic acid with NaOH to form non-volatile sodium methanoate, then distill to obtain water; filtration removes sand but acid would still co-distill due to similar boiling point.

questions.question: A quantity of electricity liberates 3.6 g of silver from its salt. What mass of aluminium will be liberated from its salt by the same quantity of electricity? [Al = 27, Ag = 108]
questions.explanation: Same charge ⇒ same moles of electrons. Ag+: 1 e− per Ag. Moles Ag = 3.6/108 = 0.0333 mol ⇒ moles e− = 0.0333. For Al3+: 3 e− per Al, so moles Al = 0.0333/3 = 0.0111. Mass Al = 0.0111×27 = 0.30 g. This equals option D, not B.

questions.question: Suitable reagents for the laboratory preparation of nitrogen are
questions.explanation: Nitrogen can be prepared by warming ammonium chloride with sodium nitrite (sodium dioxonitrate(III)): \(\text{NH}_4\text{Cl} + \text{NaNO}_2 \rightarrow \text{N}_2 + \text{NaCl} + 2\text{H}_2\text{O}\).

questions.question: The number of electrons in the valence shell of an element of atomic number 14 is
questions.explanation: Atomic number 14 is silicon: electronic configuration ends in \(3s^2 3p^2\), giving 4 valence electrons.

questions.question: What volume of oxygen will remain after reacting 8 cm3 of hydrogen gas with 20 cm3 of oxygen gas?
questions.explanation: Reaction: \(2\text{H}_2 + \text{O}_2 \rightarrow 2\text{H}_2\text{O}\). 8 cm3 H2 needs 4 cm3 O2. Oxygen left = 20 − 4 = 16 cm3.

questions.question: If one of the following oxides is heated with hydrogen or carbon using a Bunsen burner, it is not reduced to the metal. Which one is it?
questions.explanation: MgO is very stable; magnesium is too reactive to be reduced by H2 or C under these conditions.

questions.question: The name for the compound shown is
questions.explanation: The structure corresponds to isopentane, IUPAC name 2-methylbutane.

questions.question: An aqueous solution of a metal salt M gives a white precipitate with NaOH which dissolves in excess NaOH. With aqueous ammonia, the solution of M also gives a white precipitate which dissolves in excess ammonia. Therefore, the cation in M is
questions.explanation: Zn(OH)2 is white and dissolves in excess NaOH (forming zincate) and also dissolves in excess NH3 (forming ammine complex).

questions.question: What is the concentration of a solution containing 2 g of NaOH in 100 cm3 of solution? [Na = 23, O = 16, H = 1]
questions.explanation: Molar mass NaOH = 40 g/mol. Moles = 2/40 = 0.05 mol. Volume = 100 cm3 = 0.1 dm3. Concentration = 0.05/0.1 = 0.50 mol dm^-3.

questions.question: How many atoms are present in 6.0 g of magnesium? [Mg = 24, \(N_A = 6.02\times 10^{23}\,\text{mol}^{-1}\)]
The radio isotope used in industrial radiography for the rapid checking of faults in welds and casting is
questions.explanation: Cobalt-60 (written as cobalt in the option) is used in industrial radiography as a gamma source.

questions.question: Beryllium and aluminium have similar properties because they

options.text: are positioned diagonally to each other

questions.explanation: Be and Al show diagonal relationship in the periodic table, giving similar properties.

questions.question: For the reaction \(mE + nF \rightleftharpoons pG + qH\), the equilibrium constant is given by
questions.explanation: By definition, \(K_c=\frac{\text{(products)}^{\text{coefficients}}}{\text{(reactants)}^{\text{coefficients}}}=\frac{[G]^p[H]^q}{[E]^m[F]^n}\).

questions.question:
(i) \(3\text{CuO}_{(s)} + 2\text{NH}_3{}_{(g)} \rightarrow 3\text{Cu}_{(s)} + 3\text{H}_2\text{O}_{(l)} + \text{N}_2{}_{(g)}\)
(ii) \(2\text{NH}_3{}_{(g)} + 3\text{Cl}_2{}_{(g)} \rightleftharpoons 6\text{HCl}_{(g)} + \text{N}_2{}_{(g)}\)
(iii) \(4\text{NH}_3{}_{(g)} + 3\text{O}_2{}_{(g)} \rightleftharpoons 6\text{H}_2\text{O}_{(l)} + 2\text{N}_2{}_{(g)}\)
The reactions represented by the equations above demonstrate the
questions.explanation: In each reaction, NH3 reduces another substance (CuO to Cu, Cl2 to HCl, O2 to H2O) while NH3 is oxidized to N2, showing reducing properties.

questions.question: The salt that reacts with dilute hydrochloric acid to produce a pungent smelling gas which decolourizes acidified purple potassium tetraoxomanganate (VII) solution is
questions.explanation: Sulphites react with dilute HCl to produce SO2, a pungent gas that decolourizes acidified KMnO4 by reduction.

questions.question: The refreshing and characteristic taste of soda water and other soft drinks is as a result of the presence in them of
questions.explanation: CO2 dissolved under pressure gives carbonated drinks their characteristic taste/fizz.

questions.question:
Which of the following are mixtures?
(i) Petroleum
(ii) Rubber latex
(iii) Vulcanizer's solution
(iv) Carbon (II) sulphide
questions.explanation: Petroleum is a mixture of hydrocarbons; rubber latex is a colloidal mixture; vulcanizer’s solution is a mixture/solution. Carbon(II) sulphide (CS2) is a pure compound.

questions.question: A balanced chemical equation obeys the law of
questions.explanation: Balancing ensures equal numbers of each atom on both sides, reflecting conservation of mass.

questions.question:
A given amount of gas occupies 10.0 dm3 at 4 atm and 273°C. The number of moles of the gas present is
[Molar volume of a gas at s.t.p. = 22.4 dm3]
questions.explanation: Use ideal gas relation relative to STP: \(n=\frac{PV}{RT}\). Here \(T=273+273=546\,K\). Without R provided, convert using STP reference: at STP, 1 mol occupies 22.4 dm3 at 1 atm and 273 K. So \(n = \frac{P_1V_1}{1\times 22.4}\times\frac{273}{T_1} = \frac{4\times 10.0}{22.4}\times\frac{273}{546} = \frac{40}{22.4}\times\frac{1}{2} \approx 1.7857\times 0.5 = 0.8929\,\text{mol}\). This corresponds to option A (0.89 mol).

questions.question: According to Charles' law, the volume of a gas becomes zero at
questions.explanation: Extrapolating Charles’ law gives absolute zero at about \(-273\,^{\circ}\text{C}\), where volume would become zero.

questions.question: A substance that is used as a ripening agent for fruits is
questions.explanation: Ethene (ethylene) is a plant hormone used to hasten fruit ripening.

questions.question: The sulphide which is insoluble in dilute hydrochloric acid is
questions.explanation: CuS is insoluble in dilute acids, whereas FeS, ZnS and Na2S react with acids to produce H2S.

questions.question: What is the pH of 0.001 mol dm^-3 solution of the sodium hydroxide?
questions.explanation: For strong base NaOH: \([\text{OH}^-]=1.0\times 10^{-3}\). \(\text{pOH}=3\). \(\text{pH}=14-3=11\). This corresponds to option D, not C.

questions.question: The type of bonding in \([\text{Cu}(\text{NH}_3)_4]^{2+}\) is
questions.explanation: NH3 donates lone pairs to Cu2+ forming coordinate (dative) bonds in the complex.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a chemical change?
questions.explanation: Rusting forms new substances (iron oxides), so it is a chemical change.

questions.question: To what temperature must a gas at 273 K be heated in order to double both its volume and pressure?
questions.explanation: From \(PV\propto T\) for fixed n: doubling P and doubling V makes \(PV\) ×4, so \(T\) must quadruple: \(T_2=4\times 273=1092\,K\).

questions.question: According to the Kinetic Theory, an increase in temperature causes the kinetic energy of particles to
questions.explanation: Average kinetic energy of particles is directly proportional to absolute temperature.

questions.question: An element used in the production of matches is
questions.explanation: Sulphur is commonly used in match heads as a combustible component.

questions.question: Which of the following gases may not be dried with concentrated sulphuric acid?
questions.explanation: Concentrated H2SO4 reacts with ammonia (a base) forming ammonium sulphate, so it cannot be used to dry NH3.

questions.question: Consecutive members of an alkane homologous series differ by
questions.explanation: This question is cut off in the provided image; the answer options are not visible so it cannot be completed from the upload.

missingQuestions: Question 12: computed result is 0.30 g (option D), but the image options show 0.3 g; ensure this matches the intended unit formatting.
Question 33: computed pH is 11 (option D), but the image shows option C=12 and D=11; correct choice is D.
